subject: RE: [junit] incompatible types
msgSnippet: Hi, You named your class Test .  This conflicts with junit.framework.Test.  Try naming your class something like TestNancy, and see if that helps. Good luck,
messageBody:
Hi,

You named your class "Test". This conflicts with junit.framework.Test. Try
naming your class something like TestNancy, and see if that helps.

Good luck,
-Larry

-----Original Message-----
From: Nancy [mailto:logmail2003@...]
Sent: Friday, February 28, 2003 3:22 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] incompatible types


hi

I have the following code:

=======================================

import junit.framework.*;
import java.util.*;

public class Test extends TestCase {
ArrayList a;
public Test(String name) {
super(name);
}
protected void setUp() {
a = new ArrayList();
}

public void test() {
assertTrue(a.size() == 8);
}

public static Test suite() {
return new TestSuite(Test.class); //This line shows incompatible
types error
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
}
}
====================================================

When the above code was compiled, I got the error saying: " incompatible
types found: junit.framework.TestSuite required : Test, return new
TestSuite(Test.class)".

My understanding is: Test extends TestSuite. I am not sure why it complains
at following line -----

return new TestSuite(Test.class);

I appreciate your help.
Thanks,
Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
